definition: extremely difficult/even more difficult
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold
on top/upon/above/upper/previous/first (of multiple parts)/to climb/to get onto/to go up/to attend (class or university)
see 上聲|上声[shang3 sheng1]
abbr. for Canada 加拿大[Jia1 na2 da4]/surname Jia

to add/plus/(used after an adverb such as 不, 大, 稍 etc, and before a disyllabic verb, to indicate that the action of the verb is applied to sth or sb previously mentioned)/to apply (restrictions etc) to (sb)/to give (support, consideration etc) to (sth)
difficult (to...)/problem/difficulty/difficult/not good
disaster/distress/to scold

sentences.english: Small property owners paying back loans.
sentences.chinese: 小業主還貸款難上加難。

sentences.english: Comparing to songs, pure music is much more difficult to search.
sentences.chinese: 不過和找歌相比，找一首音樂更是難上加難。

sentences.english: It is extremely difficult for foreign brands to enter into Japan main market.
sentences.chinese: 外國品牌，進入日本主流市場是難上加難的。

sentences.english: “Change is hard,” he said, “and big change is harder.
sentences.chinese: “變革並非易事，”他說“大的改變更是難上加難”。

sentences.english: And without a strong recovery, it will be even harder to repair the budget.
sentences.chinese: 而沒有強有力的恢復，要去平衡預算更加難上加難。

sentences.english: That reduces even further the tickets available to Joe Public.
sentences.chinese: 這樣，普通大衆能得到演出票的機會更是難上加難。

sentences.english: This will make it exceedingly difficult to reverse the trend in the future.
sentences.chinese: 這無疑使得在遙遠的未來徹底改變這種狀況難上加難。

sentences.english: But such posts increasingly look like gems among dross.
sentences.chinese: 但是要找這樣的貼子越來越像沙裏淘金，難上加難。

sentences.english: In today’s turbulent economy, it is even more difficult.
sentences.chinese: 在當今動盪的經濟，它更是難上加難。

definition: to turn a blind eye to
requirement/necessary condition (math)
to sleep peacefully (idiom)/(fig.) to rest easy/to be free of worries
to avoid the important and dwell on the trivial/to keep silent about major charges while admitting minor ones
retort with challenging questions/debate
proletariat/abbr. for 普羅列塔利亞|普罗列塔利亚[pu3 luo2 lie4 ta3 li4 ya4] plus masses/also written 無產階級|无产阶级[wu2 chan3 jie1 ji2] in PRC Marxist theory
to produce the opposite of the desired result
lit. to see a gap and stick in a needle (idiom); fig. to make use of every second and every inch
lit. mustn't speak of two things on the same day (idiom); not to be mentioned in the same breath/incomparable
pinyin: bu4 ke3 tong2 ri4 er2 yu3

definition: to fight alone (idiom)
to oppose each other with equal harshness (idiom); tit for tat/measure for measure
many men, a great force (idiom); many hands provide great strength/There is safety in numbers.
to seize every opportunity/to be full of tricks
extremely rare (idiom)/once in a blue moon
lit. dragons and snakes mingle (idiom)/fig. a mix of good people and scumbags
to shrink back/to flinch
